pull.title: Avoid triggering undefined behaviour (std::memset(nullptr, 0, 0)) if an invalid string is passed to DecodeSecret(...)
pull.body:
Avoid triggering undefined behaviour (`std::memset(nullptr, 0, 0)`) if an invalid string is passed to `DecodeSecret(...)`.

Background reading: [memcpy (and friends) with NULL pointers](https://www.imperialviolet.org/2016/06/26/nonnull.html)

Steps to reproduce:

```
./configure --with-sanitizers=undefined && make check && ./test/functional/test_runner.py
```

events.body: Introduced in PR #11372 (119b0f85e2). Friendly ping @sipa â€“ would you mind reviewing? :-)
Shouldn't `memory_cleanse` be more robust in handling zero-length data?
@MarcoFalke Sure! Added a commit. Please re-review :-)

> Shouldn't memory_cleanse be more robust in handling zero-length data?

@MarcoFalke the same for `memset`?

-0 ae17de5 because it changes `memory_cleanse` invariant.

IMO should avoid the call to `memory_cleanse`.
@MarcoFalke I think @promag has a good point. Now reverted to the original version.
@promag Thanks for reviewing. Now updated. Please re-review :-)

issue.title: build: Run functional tests and benchmarks under the undefined behaviour sanitizer (UBSan)
issue.body:
Run functional tests and benchmarks under the undefined behaviour sanitizer (UBSan).

This will make Travis automatically detect issues such as:
* #14242: Avoid triggering undefined behaviour (`std::memset(nullptr, 0, 0)`) if an invalid string is passed to `DecodeSecret(...)`
* #14239: Avoid dividing by zero (undefined behaviour) in `EstimateMedianVal` (policy)/`ConnectTip` (validation)/`CreateTransaction` (wallet)
* #13546: wallet: Avoid potential use of uninitialized value `bnb_used` in `CWallet::CreateTransaction(...)`

Addresses issue #14059.

issue.title: functional tests fail --with-sanitizers=undefined
issue.body:
Steps to reproduce on master and 0.17:

```sh
git checkout bitcoin/master && make distclean
./configure --with-sanitizers=undefined CC=clang CXX=clang++
make -j 16 check && ./test/functional/test_runner.py -j 16
```

Runs into some divide by zero and other issues...

events.body: Could remove the suppression from the file in contrib?

@MarcoFalke Good point! Added commit 1cab4bb7e09c9d68e104460b67e5804848cd3c2e which removes UBSan suppression.

Please re-review :-)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14239](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14239.html) (Avoid dividing by zero (undefined behaviour) in EstimateMedianVal (policy)/ConnectTip (validation)/CreateTransaction (wallet) by practicalswift)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

issue.title: fix an undefined behavior in uint::SetHex
issue.body:
Decrementing psz beyond the beginning of the string is UB, even though
the out-of-bounds pointer is never dereferenced.

I don't think any clang sanitizer covers this, so I don't see any way a test could catch the original behavior.

events.body: @MarcoFalke Could this one get a release milestone? :-)

Agree with @laanwj, also (nit) could squash.

utACK 524a876 otherwise.

events.message: Avoid triggering undefined behaviour (std::memset(nullptr, 0, 0)) if an invalid string is passed to DecodeSecret(...)

events.body: @laanwj @promag Good points. Fixed and squashed. Please re-review :-)

comments.body: This check is no longer needed?

Notes
If size() is 0, data() may or may not return a null pointer.
https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/container/vector/data
We don't need to `memory_cleanse` if `data.size()` is zero, right?
Now calling `memory_cleanse` only if `data.data() != nullptr` and `data.size() > 0`.
seems like an `!data.empty()` check would be enough here?
